intro: Cyrtandra fulvisericea, commonly known as the golden hairroot. It is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands, including Hawaii, Tahiti, and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. Cyrtandra fulvisericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats.
